body.name: Garmin Venu® Sq 2 GPS Smartwatch, All-Day Health Monitoring, Long-Lasting Battery Life, AMOLED Display, Slate and Shadow Gray
body.merchantInfo: Sold by NE Solutions and Fulfilled by Amazon.
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Thursday, February 15. Order within 4 hrs 45 mins
FREE delivery Saturday, February 17. Order within 6 hrs 45 mins
features: See everything clearly with large, easy-to-read text on the bright AMOLED display that includes an always-on mode, perfect for quick glances
With up to 11 days of battery life in smartwatch mode, you won’t have to take your watch off every night to charge — which means a more complete 24/7 picture of your health

Health is important to you, so monitor everything from your Body Battery energy levels, sleep score, respiration, hydration and stress to women’s health, heart rate and more (This device is intended to give an estimate of your activity and metrics)
Find new ways to keep your body moving with more than 25 built-in indoor and GPS sports apps, including walking, running, cycling, HIIT, swimming, golf and many more
Never miss a call, text or social media alert from your paired Apple or Android smartphone with smart notifications delivered right to your wrist

Use free preloaded workouts that include cardio, yoga, strength, HIIT and even Pilates; create your own in the Garmin Connect smartphone app, or try Garmin Coach free adaptive training plans to help you prepare for your next running challenge
With a supported bank, leave your cash and cards at home; Garmin Pay contactless payments let you pay for purchases on the go

Head out with peace of mind with safety and tracking features, including incident detection (during select activities) and Assistance, both of which send messages with your live location to emergency contacts (Requires setup and your smartphone to be in an area with network coverage where data connectivity is available)
Personalize with watch faces, apps and widgets from our Connect IQ Store, and review your health and fitness data in detail with the free Garmin Connect smartphone app
body.description: Let’s find a new way to move with the Venu® Sq 2 smartwatch. Featuring a bright AMOLED display, this GPS smartwatch combines daily style with health monitoring and fitness features that inspire you to connect mind and body. With up to 11 days of battery life, you won’t have to take off your watch every night to charge it — which means a more complete 24/7 picture of your health. Get heart rate, sleep score, stress tracking, Body Battery™ energy levels and so much more (This device is intended to give an estimate of your activity and metrics). With 25 preloaded sports apps for indoor or outdoor activities, you can try something new, including running, cardio, strength, HIIT and more. Never miss a call or text with smart notifications delivered to your wrist when paired to your Apple® or Android™ smartphone. Get detailed health and fitness data plus workouts in the free Garmin Connect™ smartphone app.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 21, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great upgrade for Garmin fitness band wearers
reviews.reviewText: Got this brand new model because my Vivosmart 4 watch band finally broke. I didn't really want to go back to a watch form factor after wearing bands for many years. But this one is super light weight and I can wear it anywhere, even in the water. The battery lasts for days. You can download the Connect IQ app and customize the watch, including adding new features and faces. Interestingly, you can create a custom face in both the IQ app, and on the watch itself, although the options are not the same and results are not consistent.Pros:- Great screen, highly visible in varying light- Good battery life. Much better than the old vivosmart 4, seems like at least a week.- GPS - seems to work well enough on walks/runs I've done.- Nice selection of exercises built in. I've only used walk/run/swim so far. The app has been trying to get me to upload personalized running plans and workouts. Just haven't got to that yet either.- User interface is _mostly_ easy to use, once you figure it out.Cons- Extra info on faces (steps, heartbeat etc), and user interface has very small fonts. It's not a big device after all. But those of us who can't focus up close have a hard time seeing the small things without the glasses- Another weird charger connector. Next version should be able to charge wirelessly. Those other guys do it.- The included band is pretty utilitarian and I already see wear around where the buckle rubs on it. At least it's replaceable with standard sized bands.Overall I am happy with this watch so far.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 25, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I have had this for almost a year now. I've not had any issues with it. Love that I can change the face to fit my needs and track what I want to track. They have several apps that you can put on the watch to use for different activities like cycling, golfing. I haven't really gotten it wet yet. Out of habit, I take it off before showering, swimming, etc. My other fitness watches were not water resistant/proof. To me it is a nice size. People mistake it for an apple watch. My battery life has been excellent between charges. I go anywhere from 7 to 14 days between charges and that usually depends on my activity as well as what the level is when I decide to charge it. Charges quickly as well. I don't have some things constantly monitor, like the O2, and that helps as well with the battery life, I'm sure. Depending on what watch face you use, some info may be too small to read if you use reading glasses and don't have them on. I get notifications for my iPhone and can read the text and see who's calling but cannot respond to call or text from watch. I'm good with that as it gives me the freedom to not feel like I have to stop what I am doing to answer. The bands are easy to change out as well.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 17, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars This is the best smart watch I have owned!
reviews.reviewText: I have been frustrated by multiple smart watches in the past. The battery life is great on this one, and it was easy to setup and use. I wish I had this years ago. My only wish is that the charger was wireless, but since the battery life is so long, and it quick charges, I don't mind.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 11, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Good choice for a new smartwatch owner
reviews.reviewText: This is my second Venu Sq, had the original Sq first, it had a lot of function problems. So I returned it and decided to go with the Venu Sq 2, since I liked the design and did not need as many features that were on other models.I does pretty good for my needs. The lack of a hiking app was dealt with a non-Garmin app. But with activities such as walking, hiking, even timer... there is not always a quick route to start. The watch does not always go right to the start function to begin tracking.And there is a lag time for some notifications.Over all I am pretty satisfied with my watch. It is stylish and battery lasts a week plus before needing to charge.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 3, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars This beats fitbit
reviews.reviewText: I bought this to replace my earlier version. This series beats my old version hands down. Screen is clear and tough. (I am not kind to my watches). The functions are great and GPS is much better and faster to track than old version. I am glad I bought this

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect for me
reviews.reviewText: Love everything about this watch. Battery is awesome and all the features are just right for helping me improve my daily routine.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 2, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Just what I wanted
reviews.reviewText: This Garmin is one of the better ones that I’ve owned. Getting approximately 11 to 12 days which I think is awesome compared to my Apple Watch. I do love my Apple Watch but I do wish that they would figure out how to make their batteries last as long as Garman does. Garmin is very good quality and it’s very lightweight. Highly recommend this Garman for anyone very easy to use and the display is not bad. Would like it a little bigger but I have to say it is good.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Delivery super fast, great product, incredible life battery
J'aime bien ma montre. Va super bien. Je la porte depuis environ 8 mois et tout va bien. Je la charge une fois semaine pas plus.
Produto muito bom, adorei. Super recomendo. Conexão rapida e facil com IOS. Bem intuitivo pelo app.
Great watch with all the features that I need and want. I have a small wrist and was worried it would look too bulky but it's very stylish. Definitely recommend!
